description: You espouse a philosophy you like “This aberration’s body must be displayed as a warning to to call the “conservation ethic.” The conservation ethic the others.” promotes the measured use, allotment, and protection of Judge: You are the guardian of unwritten ancient laws natural lands and waters. You employ your ethic as an aid in inspired by nature. As someone with such knowledge, you your efforts to sustain the natural world: its forests, lakes, believe you have the power to judge those who have sinned seas, and all the strange and wondrous creatures that live against the natural order. When you judge, you can sentence within it. the malefactor to be excommunicated from sacred groves, In order to engender a similar ethic in your companions the deep woods, and all other places where nature still and others that you meet, you offer poetic references to nature reigns supreme. when traveling, when fi rst seeing a new vista, or when you To the extent you are able to communicate your judgments otherwise deem appropriate: to other druids, wild animals, treants, and other creatures of “Spend a heartbeat and notice every waving leaf, every tendril the wild, your judgments stand. Of course, the easiest way of mist in the dark woods, and every humming insect.” to ensure your judgment is to take matters into your own “The deer, the wolf, the oak, the fi sh, and the great birds are our hands against those who have sinned most heinously (such fellows, and they can be wronged, just as you can be wronged.” as undead, through their mere existence). “An unchecked and untempered appetite will devour green plains In most cases, other druids are willing to abide by your and leave behind only a barren wasteland.” judgments, if you show through your actions that you are “What soul can’t fi nd peace and spiritual renewal in the forlorn willing to abide by theirs. cry of the whippoorwill or the arguments of the frogs around a pond However, no civilized court of law, whether a council of at night?” village elders or a king’s tribunal, recognizes the right of “Whatever happens to the wild places, the pure waters, and druids and their judgments. description: Starting at 4th level, you can exhort your allies to discover a reservoir of energy they didn’t think they had. Once per day, as a standard action, you can grant temporary hit points equal to your marshal level to any or all of your allies within 30 feet (but not to yourself). If the ally’s current hit point total is no more than half his full normal hit points, the number of temporary hit points granted to that character is doubled (to twice your marshal level). This ability only affects allies with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher who can hear you and understand your language. The temporary hit points last for up to 1 minute per marshal level. At 8th level, you can use this ability twice per day. You can use it three times per day at 12th level, four times per day at 16th level, and fi ve times per day at 20th level. If you use this ability on a creature that is still under the effect of a previous use, the new temporary hit points overlap (do not stack with) the temporary hit points the creature had remaining. STARTING PACKAGES Package 1: The Defender Dwarf Marshal

description: Do any deserve mercy? No. very least! Leniency and compassion are words used to describe weak dealings toward those who have been judged and found want- CHARGING SMITE ing. description: You begin almost every utterance with a refer- paladin level to any evil creature you hit (in addition to the ence to your god. normal bonus damage dealt by a smite). If the charge attack “As the truth of [your deity] tells us . . .” misses, the smite ability is not considered used. This is a “If [your deity] allows . . ..” supernatural ability. “In the name of [your deity], the benefi cent, the merciful . . .” If you do not begin an utterance with a reference to your STARTING PACKAGES deity, you wrap up with one.
